title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The Fuel Tax rates specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to 4.3 cents per gallon for certain periods. The Fuel Tax rates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to 4.3 cents per gallon for specific periods, with changes to sections related to aviation gasoline and termination of taxes. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust Fuel Tax rates to 4.3 cents per gallon for specific periods related to aviation gasoline. Sections regarding ticket taxes and transfers to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund are also modified for different timeframes. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust Fuel Tax rates for aviation gasoline. Sections related to ticket taxes and transfers to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund are modified for specific timeframes, including the termination of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate after September 29, 1997. Floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon imposed on aviation fuel held before tax-increase date. Liability for tax falls on person holding fuel on tax-increase date. Liability for tax on aviation fuel held on tax-increase date. Payment method and time specified by the Secretary. Definitions include reference to the Internal Revenue Code and the tax-increase date. The term "the Code" refers to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The term "tax-increase date" is defined as 7 calendar days after the enactment of the Act. "Aviation fuel" is defined as per section 4093 of the Code. Aviation fuel is considered "held by a person" if title has passed to that person. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate. The tax on aviation fuel does not apply to certain uses. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate. The tax on aviation fuel does not apply to certain uses or to aviation fuel held by a person exclusively for a specific purpose. No tax is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held by a person is exempt from tax if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. Fuel exempt from tax under paragraph (4) is not considered. Controlled groups are defined for corporations. Controlled groups for corporations are defined under paragraph (4), with the term "controlled group" having specific criteria outlined in the tax code. Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, the phrase "at least 80 percent" in subsection (6) shall be replaced with "more than 50 percent." Similar principles apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. All provisions of law applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code also apply, insofar as applicable and not inconsistent with this subsection. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. SEC. 3 amends Section 9502(b) of the Code to transfer taxes collected during the taxable period regardless of when they were paid. The amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
